items.sentence: Tom always tries to do what he thinks is right.
Tom and Mary are on good terms with each other.
Tom and Mary are planning a picnic at the lake.
Tom and Mary both complained about the weather.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was sick.
Tom was back in Boston during the summer break.
Tom said that Mary was good at speaking French.
Tom convinced Mary to go to the party with him.
Tom could stay with us tonight if he wanted to.
I don\'t usually peel apples before I eat them.
I doubt that we\'ll be allowed to do that here.
You haven\'t lived in Boston as long as I have.
You never told me that you didn\'t like Boston.
I wonder whether or not Tom has studied French.
I wonder whether or not Tom still remembers me.
I wonder whether or not Tom was here yesterday.
I wonder whether or not Tom will come tomorrow.
I just don\'t want to be left completely alone.
I just want to make sure that you\'re prepared.
Tom is currently serving three years in prison.
